content: rosemary socks by teaknitting are you like me a keen knitter with lots of leftover yarns maybe some minis and mohair as well do you love super soft warm and fluffy socks then this is an easy pattern for you just grab three colors that speak to you and combine them each with a strand of matching mohair some speckles will make them even livelier happy knitting #teaknitting #rosemarysocks 1 size medium size woman gauge 30 sts and 38 row = 10 cm / 4 inches of stockinette stitch in the round yarn these socks are knitted in fingering weight yarn each color held together with a strand of matching mohair all the yarns i used for my sample are leftovers so i can´t name them but for example arwetta classic 212m/50g and tilia 210m/25g both by filcolana would do fine my socks have quite a long leg and they weigh 109 grams all together colorways i used three colors but you can mix and match as you like be creative and use colors that you have in your stash and most importantly colors that will make you happy needles 2 25 mm/us 1 or size needed to obtain the gauge if you knit tight i suggest one size bigger needles for the colorwork motif i used circular needles but you can use double pointed needles as well notions tapestry needle stitch marker scissors abbreviations k knit k2tog knit 2 together p2tog purl 2 together n1 needle 1 / instep n2 needle 2 / back of calf sole p purl rs right side ssk slip slip knit sts stitches ws wrong side #teaknitting #rosemarysocks 2 cuff color 1 light grey in my sample cast on 64 sts with the method that you prefer divide your stitches over two needles magic loop method 32 sts on both needle 1 and needle 2 make sure your work does not twist as you join in the round make the ribbing for 18 rounds as follows *k2 p2* repeat *-* leg please note my tip below in my sample the leg is knit in three colors rounds 1-4 knit continuing with the same color than the cuff color 1 don´t cut the yarn but continue fading the color round 5 knit in color 2 in my sample peachy pink round 6 knit in color 1 round 7 knit in color 2 round 8 knit in color 1 rounds 9-10 knit in color 2 round 11 knit in color 1 then cut the yarn rounds 12-19 knit in color 2 don´t cut the yarn follow the chart for 7 rounds using colors 2 and 3 mustard in my sample for mirror image both socks have their own chart cut the yarn of color 3 continue knitting in color 2 until you have reached your desired length 36 more rounds in my sample cut the yarn of color 2 tip i like to keep color change line in the middle back of the leg should you
